column4: Brokenwall: websearch for the product lines and you will find guides
Brokenwall: if the system is a laptop then try websearching that too, there may be specific guides for it and how to get linux running nice
Rabbi1: it can look how you want, so screenshots are fairly pointless
Joe_: that's as much as I know. I never got it running
Gnakai: you'd be better in #vmware for vmware settings
Brokenwall: I gave a command. I need the output from it
im on my desktop, my laptop has no way to get a network connection, so I can only give you the information you want line by line
yes the Wifi Scan shows networks, as well as my network
but nothing will connection, WPA, WEP, or unsecured
tried WICD it won't connect either
I am also unable to connection via CLI using iwlist
sorry, i meant iwconfig, which won't connect,
yes there are, I have also tried going back to 9.04 as well as seeing if 10.04 works, and neither network connections work
i'd look in your routers logs to see if it recieves the dhcp request
